def_cn: (尤指固定地毯的)大头钉，平头钉
def_en: See also:thumbtack; A tack is a short nail with a broad, flat head, especially one that is used for fastening carpets to the floor.  to get down to brass tacks→see: brass;
If you tack something to a surface, you pin it there with tacks or drawing pins.
If you change tack or try a different tack, you try a different method for dealing with a situation.

def_cn: (使)(船只)曲折航行，蜿蜒航行
def_en: If a sailing boat is tacking or if the people in it tack it, it is sailing towards a particular point in a series of sideways movements rather than in a straight line.

def_cn: （用大针脚）粗缝，暂时缝上
def_en: If you tack pieces of material together, you sew them together with big, loose stitches in order to hold them firmly or check that they fit, before sewing them properly.
